title: How to Make Streusel Topped Banana Bread

steps.headline: Make the streusel topping first.
steps.description: Mix the melted butter in with the remaining ingredients using a fork. Continue to mix until it resembles chunky crumbs. You will need to use your fingers to break into smaller pieces.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 325ºF.
steps.description: Line or spray the baking pans.

steps.headline: Make the cake mixture.
steps.description: Beat the eggs in a separate bowl until light and frothy.

steps.headline: Pour in the oil and sugar and stir through.
In another bowl, combine the flour, cinnamon, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
Pour the flour mixture into the egg mixture and mix until combined.
Divide the cake batter evenly between both pans.
steps.description: Spread the streusel topping  across the batter in each pan. Make sure it is balanced across the cakes.

steps.headline: Place the cakes in the oven and bake for 55-65 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted.
Remove from oven and allow to cool on cooling racks.

text: Make the streusel topping first. Mix the melted butter in with the remaining ingredients using a fork. Continue to mix until it resembles chunky crumbs. You will need to use your fingers to break into smaller pieces. Preheat the oven to 325ºF. Line or spray the baking pans. Make the cake mixture. Beat the eggs in a separate bowl until light and frothy. Pour in the oil and sugar and stir through. Add the bananas and vanilla. In another bowl, combine the flour, cinnamon, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.  Pour the flour mixture into the egg mixture and mix until combined.  Divide the cake batter evenly between both pans. Spread the streusel topping  across the batter in each pan. Make sure it is balanced across the cakes. Place the cakes in the oven and bake for 55-65 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted.  Remove from oven and allow to cool on cooling racks.
